<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Audit Committee
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Board of Directors has established an Audit Committee currently composed of two independent directors who report to the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;Messrs. Prins and Shenoy, each of whom is an independent director under the NYSE MKT listing standards, serve as members of our Audit Committee. Mr. Prins is the Chairman of our Audit Committee.&#160;&#160;In addition, we have determined that Messrs. Prins and Shenoy are &#8220;audit committee financial experts,&#8221; as that term is defined under Item 407 of Regulation S-K of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee is responsible for meeting with our independent accountants regarding, among other issues, audits and the adequacy of our accounting and control systems.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation Committee
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Board of Directors has established a Compensation Committee composed of two independent directors, Messrs. Shenoy and Prins.&#160;&#160;Mr. Shenoy is the current Chairman of our Compensation Committee. The Compensation Committee&#8217;s purpose is to review and approve compensation paid to our officers and directors and to administer our 2008 Omnibus Incentive Plan.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Compensation Committee is comprised of two independent members of the Board of Directors, Richard Prins and Sudhakar Shenoy.&#160;&#160;No executive officer of the Company served as a director or member of the compensation committee of any other entity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Compensation Committee met three times during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 and was responsible for determining executive compensation and the award of stock options to employees and directors during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160;&#160;No consultants were used by the Compensation Committee during this fiscal year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In the future, we intend to establish a nominating and corporate governance committee.&#160;&#160;The primary purpose of the nominating and corporate governance committee will be to identify individuals qualified to become directors, recommend to the Board of Directors the candidates for election by stockholders or appointment by the Board of Directors to fill a vacancy, recommend to the Board of Directors the composition and chairs of Board of Directors committees, develop and recommend to the Board of Directors guidelines for effective corporate governance, and lead an annual review of the performance of the Board of Directors and each of its committees.&#160;&#160;We do not have any formal process for stockholders to nominate a director for election to our Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;Currently, nominations are selected or recommended by a majority of the independent directors as stated in Section 804(a) of the NYSE MKT Company Guide.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Audit Committee Financial Expert
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Audit Committee will at all times be composed exclusively of &#8220;independent directors&#8221; who are &#8220;financially literate,&#8221; as defined under the NYSE MKT listing standards.&#160;&#160;The NYSE MKT&#8217;s listing standards define &#8220;financially literate&#8221; as being able to read and understand fundamental financial statements, including a company&#8217;s balance sheet, income statement and cash flow statement.&#160;&#160;In addition, we must certify to the NYSE MKT that the Audit Committee has, and will continue to have, at least one member who has past employment experience in finance or accounting, requisite professional certification in accounting, or other comparable experience or background that results in the individual&#8217;s financial sophistication.&#160;&#160;The Board of Directors has determined that Messrs. Prins and Shenoy satisfy the NYSE MKT&#8217;s definition of financial sophistication and qualify as &#8220;audit committee financial experts,&#8221; as defined under rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Board and Committee Meetings
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, our Board of Directors held fifteen meetings.&#160;&#160;Although we do not have any formal policy regarding director attendance at our annual meetings, we attempt to schedule our annual meetings so that all of our directors can attend.&#160;&#160;During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, all of our directors attended 100% of the meetings of the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, there were seven meetings of the audit committee, all of which were attended by all of the members of the committee.&#160;&#160;There were three compensation committee meetings held during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Communications with Directors
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Any director may be contacted by writing to him c/o the Secretary of the Company at the Company&#8217;s principal executive offices.&#160;&#160;Communications to the non-management directors as a group may be sent to the Independent Directors c/o the Secretary of the Company at the same address.&#160;&#160;We will promptly forward, without screening other than normal security procedures for all our mail, all correspondence to the indicated director or directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Indemnification Agreements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are party to indemnification agreements with each of the executive officers and directors.&#160;&#160;Such indemnification agreements require us to indemnify these individuals to the fullest extent permitted by law.&#160;&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the indemnification agreements, we intend to agree to indemnify our officers and directors against expenses, judgments, fines, penalties or other amounts actually and reasonably incurred by the independent director in connection with any proceeding if the officer or director acted in good faith and did not derive an improper personal benefit from the transaction or occurrence that is the basis of the proceeding.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Annual Meeting Attendance
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We do not have a formal policy requiring directors to attend stockholder meetings but we encourage members of the Board of Directors to attend the annual meeting of stockholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Code of Conduct and Ethics
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	A code of business conduct and ethics is a written standard designed to deter wrongdoing and to promote (a) honest and ethical conduct, (b) full, fair, accurate, timely and understandable disclosure in regulatory filings and public statements, (c) compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, (d) the prompt reporting violation of the code and (e) accountability for adherence to the code.&#160;&#160;The Company has adopted a written code of ethics (the &#8220;Senior Financial Officer Code of Ethics&#8221;) that applies to the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and senior financial officers, including the Company&#8217;s Principal Accounting Officer, Controller and persons performing similar functions (collectively, the &#8220;Senior Financial Officers&#8221;) in accordance with applicable federal securities laws and the rules of the NYSE MKT.&#160;&#160;Investors may view our Senior Financial Officer Code of Ethics on the corporate governance subsection of the investor relations portion of our website at www.igcinc.us.&#160;&#160;The Company has established separate audit and compensation committees that are described below.&#160;&#160;The Company does not have a separate nominating committee.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, Board of Director nominations occur by either selection or recommendation of a majority of the independent directors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, requires our directors, executive officers and persons who beneficially own more than 10% of our common stock to file reports of their ownership of shares with the Securities and Exchange Commission.&#160;&#160;Such executive officers, directors and stockholders are required by SEC regulation to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a) reports they file.&#160;&#160;Based solely upon review of the copies of such reports received by us, our senior management believes that all reports required to be filed under Section 16(a) for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 were filed in a timely manner.
</DIV>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<A NAME="INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_ITEM11">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 11.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Executive Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Overview of Compensation Policy
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Compensation Committee is empowered to review and approve, or in some cases recommend for the approval of the full Board of Directors the annual compensation for the executive officers of our company.&#160;&#160;This Committee has the responsibility for establishing, implementing and monitoring our compensation strategy and policy.&#160;&#160;Among its principal duties, the Committee ensures that the total compensation of the executive officers is fair, reasonable and competitive.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Objectives and Philosophies of Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The primary objective of our compensation policy, including the executive compensation policy, is to help attract and retain qualified, energetic managers who are enthusiastic about our mission and products and services.&#160;&#160;The policy is designed to reward the achievement of specific annual and long-term strategic goals aligning executive performance with company growth and stockholder value.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Board of Directors strives to promote an ownership mentality among key leaders and the Board of Directors.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Setting Executive Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The compensation policy is designed to reward performance.&#160;&#160;In measuring executive officers&#8217; contribution to our company, the Compensation Committee considers numerous factors including our growth and financial performance as measured by revenue, gross margin and net income before taxes, among other key performance indicators.&#160;&#160;Regarding most compensation matters, including executive and director compensation, management provides recommendations to the Compensation Committee; however, the Compensation Committee does not delegate any of its functions to others in setting compensation.&#160;&#160;The Compensation Committee does not currently engage any consultant related to executive or director compensation matters.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Stock price performance has not been a factor in determining annual compensation because the trading price of shares of our common stock is subject to a variety of factors outside of management&#8217;s control.&#160;&#160;We do not subscribe to an exact formula for allocating cash and non-cash compensation.&#160;&#160;However, a significant percentage of total executive compensation is performance-based.&#160;&#160;Historically, the majority of the incentives to executives have been in the form of non-cash incentives in order to better align the goals of executives with the goals of stockholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Elements of Company&#8217;s Compensation Plan
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The principal components of compensation for our executive officers are:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z9D055E158A1C48FCB443F8097CDA0546" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

	base salary,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZDE8AF7288F3D49AE8FDAB84A3AC5EDC6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z49E32EAADA61449E914B6F43ADFE244D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>

	performance-based incentive cash compensation,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z0F339662A93444A7A1F84DCE207E694F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZE1A05AAA3D46420798F9CF3FD8D03ED1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	right to purchase our common stock at a preset price (via stock options), and
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZE7F0C9AE005D4CA8AC1D87E480F40123" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZFFCAFAD65A7E46379806842144FE026A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Base Salary
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We provide named executive officers and other employees with base salary to compensate them for services rendered during the fiscal year.&#160;&#160;Base salary ranges for named executive officers are determined for each executive based on his or her position and responsibility.&#160;&#160;During its review of base salaries for executives, the Committee primarily considers:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZCC0B5DBAA0794702A81BFC2B81967B33" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 72PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	market data,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZD9D2259C8F394807B15C93B48C29EEE0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z6AAA049608E84DCABF1E1E0314922EDF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	internal review of the executives&#8217; compensation, both individually and relative to other officers, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z6765802BCCCF47E0BE999572B84EF3FA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

</TD>

	individual performance of the executive.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Salary levels are typically evaluated annually as part of our performance review process, as well as upon a promotion or other change in job responsibility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Performance-Based Incentive Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The management incentive plan gives the Committee the latitude to design cash and stock-based incentive compensation programs to promote high performance and achievement of corporate goals, encourage the growth of stockholder value and allow key employees to participate in the long-term growth and profitability of our company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Ownership Guidelines
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	To align the interests of the Board of Directors directly with the interests of the stockholders, the Committee recommends that each Board member maintain a minimum ownership interest in our company.&#160;&#160;Currently, the Compensation Committee recommends that each Board member own a minimum of 5,000 shares of our common stock with such stock to be acquired within a reasonable time following election to the Board.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Employee Stock Option Program
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The employee stock option program assists us to:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TABLE ID="Z8EAE847136DC4CEBB54800D1E1F350B3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

	enhance the link between the creation of stockholder value and long-term executive incentive compensation,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZC88D603E9285406AACDB6CAB2676F9C1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z0511276FC6E24AD1BB3A2A66E80EB085" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TR>

	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>

	maintain competitive levels of total compensation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Stock option award levels will be determined based on market data and will vary among participants based on their positions within the company and are granted at the Committee&#8217;s regularly scheduled meeting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	All grants of options or common stock occurred on or before fiscal year March 31, 2016. In fiscal 2009, no option grants were made.&#160;&#160;In fiscal 2010, 139,300 stock options were granted (the &#8220;2010 Options&#8221;) with an exercise price of $10.0 per share and an expiration of May 13, 2014.&#160;&#160;No grants were made in fiscal 2011.&#160;&#160;In the fiscal year ended March 31, 2012, 130,045 stock options (the &#8220;2012 Options&#8221;) were granted with an exercise price of $5.60 per share and an expiration of June 27, 2016.&#160;In fiscal 2013 we granted 633,030 shares of common stock. &#160;In fiscal 2014 and 2015, we granted 146,073 and 359,021 shares of common stock, respectively.&#160;&#160;As of March 31, 2016, under our 2008 Omnibus Incentive Plan, we had granted 2,214,950 shares of common stock and 139,300 stock options. As of April 1, 2016, there were an aggregate of 1,276,359 shares available for future grants.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Perquisites and Other Personal Benefits
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We provide some executive officers with perquisites and other personal benefits that we and the Committee believe are reasonable and consistent with our overall compensation program to enable us to attract and retain superior employees for key positions.&#160;&#160;The Committee periodically reviews the levels of perquisites and other personal benefits provided to named executive officers.&#160;&#160;Some executive officers receive the use of company automobiles and an assistant among other perquisites.&#160;&#160;Each employee of our company is entitled to term life insurance, premiums for which are paid by us.&#160;&#160;In addition, each employee is entitled to receive certain medical and dental benefits, part of the cost of which the employee funds.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Accounting and Tax Considerations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our stock option grant policy will be impacted by the implementation of FASB ASC 718 (previously referred to as SFAS No. 123R), which was adopted in the first quarter of fiscal year 2006.&#160;&#160;Under this accounting pronouncement, we are required to value unvested stock options granted prior to the adoption of FASB ASC 718 under the fair value method and expense those amounts in the income statement over the stock option&#8217;s remaining vesting period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code restricts deductibility of executive compensation paid to our chief executive officer and each of the four other most highly compensated executive officers holding office at the end of any year to the extent such compensation exceeds $1,000,000 for any of such officers in any year and does not qualify for an exception under Section 162(m) or related regulations.&#160;&#160;The Committee&#8217;s policy is to qualify its executive compensation for deductibility under applicable tax laws to the extent practicable.&#160;&#160;In the future, the Committee will continue to evaluate the advisability of qualifying its executive compensation for full deductibility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation for Executive Officers of the Company
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We pay IGN, LLC, an affiliate of Ram Mukunda, our President and Chief Executive Officer, $4,500 per month for office space and certain general and administrative services, an amount which is not intended as compensation for Mr. Mukunda.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The following table sets forth information concerning all cash and non-cash compensation awarded to, earned by or paid to (i) all individuals serving as the Company&#8217;s principal executive officer or acting in a similar capacity during the last two completed fiscal years, regardless of compensation level, and (ii) the Company&#8217;s two most highly compensated executive officers other than the principal executive officers serving at the end of the last two completed fiscal years (collectively, the &#8220;Named Executive Officers&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(1)&#160;&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV>
	The salaries reflect amounts paid by the Company in the fiscal year. IGC is contractually obligated to pay the CEO an annual compensation of $300,000. The amounts paid were $150,000 and $275,000 in fiscal 2016 and 2015 respectively. The Option amounts reported represent the fair value of option or stock awards to the named executive officer as computed on the date of the option grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model, or in the case of stock grants the closing price for the day the issuance vests. For Mr. Mukunda the stock grant includes a special grant approved by the stockholders on September 12, 2014 that vested in November 2015.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; WIDTH: AUTO">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Granted pending vesting.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	38
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage72"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation of Directors
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	No cash compensation was awarded to, earned by or paid to the directors in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 for service as directors.&#160;&#160;In the fiscal year ended 2016, our non-employee directors each received 105,000 shares of our common stock from the 2008 Omnibus Incentive Plan and an additional special grant of 250,000 shares each, which was approved by the Company&#8217;s shareholders on September 12, 2014 that vested on November 4, 2015.&#160;&#160;All compensation paid to our employee director is set forth in the tables summarizing executive officer compensation above.&#160;&#160;The Option Awards column reflects the grant date fair value, in accordance with Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) Topic 718, Compensation &#8212; Stock Compensation (formerly Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS) No. 123R) for awards pursuant to the Company&#8217;s equity incentive program.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Assumptions used in the calculation of these amounts for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 are included in Note 16, &#8220;Stock-Based Compensation&#8221; to the Company&#8217;s audited financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, included in this report.&#160;&#160;The Company cautions that the amounts reported in the Director Compensation Table for these awards may not represent the amounts that the directors will actually realize from the awards.&#160;&#160;Whether, and to what extent, a director realizes value will depend on the Company&#8217;s actual operating performance and stock price fluctuations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We pay IGN, LLC, an affiliate of Mr. Mukunda, $4,500 per month for office space and certain general and administrative services.&#160;&#160;We believe, based on rents and fees for similar services in the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area, that the fee charged by IGN LLC is at least as favorable as we could have obtained from an unaffiliated third party.&#160;&#160;The agreement is on a month-to-month basis and may be terminated by the Board of Directors at any time without notice.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Employment Contracts
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Ram Mukunda has served as President and Chief Executive Officer of our company since its inception.&#160;&#160;On May 22, 2008, we, IGC-M and Mr. Mukunda entered into an Employment Agreement that expired on May 21, 2014.&#160;&#160;On July 14, 2014 we, IGC-M and Mr. Mukunda entered into the 2014 Employment Agreement. Pursuant to the 2014 Employment Agreement, which will be effective until July 2019, we pay Mr. Mukunda a base salary of $300,000 per year.&#160;&#160;The Employment Agreement provides that the Board of Directors of our company may review and update the targets and amounts for the net revenue and salary and contract bonuses on an annual basis.&#160;&#160;Mr. Mukunda is entitled to benefits, including insurance, reimbursement of business expenses, 20 days of annual paid vacation, sick leave, domestic help, driver, cook and a car (subject to partial reimbursement by Mr. Mukunda of lease payments for the car and reimbursement of business expenses).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The term of the Employment Agreement is five years, extended by one year after which employment will become at-will.&#160;&#160;The Employment Agreement is terminable by us for death, disability and cause.&#160;&#160;In the event of a termination without cause, including a change of control, we would be required to pay Mr. Mukunda his full compensation for three years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation Risk Assessment
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In setting compensation, the Compensation Committee considers the risks to our stockholders and to achievement of our goals that may be inherent in our compensation programs.&#160;&#160;The Compensation Committee reviewed and discussed its assessment with management and outside legal counsel and concluded that our compensation programs are within industry standards and are designed with the appropriate balance of risk and reward to align employees&#8217; interests with those of our company and do not incent employees to take unnecessary or excessive risks.&#160;&#160;Although a portion of our executives&#8217; and employees&#8217; compensation is performance-based and &#8220;at risk,&#8221; we believe our compensation plans are appropriately structured and are not reasonably likely to result in a material adverse effect on our company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	39
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	The number of options outstanding is 1,300,450 with an average exercise price of $0.56. Each option exercised at an average price of $0.56 entitles the holder to one tenth of a share of common stock. Therefore, 10 options each exercised at $0.56 for an aggregate price of $5.60 entitle the holder to one share of common stock. The total number of securities to be issued upon the exercise of all outstanding options is 130,045 shares.&#160;The options expire on June 27, 2016.
</TD>

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<A NAME="INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_ITEM12">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The following table sets forth information regarding the beneficial ownership of our common stock as of June 25, 2016 by each person known by us to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of our outstanding shares of common stock, each of our executive officers and directors, and all of our officers and directors as a group.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and does not necessarily indicate beneficial ownership for any other purpose.&#160;&#160;Under these rules, beneficial ownership includes those shares of common stock over which the stockholder has sole or shared voting or investment power.&#160;&#160;It also includes shares of common stock that the stockholder has a right to acquire within 60 days through the exercise of any option, warrant or other right.&#160;&#160;The percentage ownership of the outstanding common stock, which is based upon shares of common stock outstanding as of June 25, 2016, is based on the assumption, expressly required by the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, that only the person or entity whose ownership is being reported has exercised options or warrants to purchase shares of our common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Unless otherwise indicated, we believe that all persons named in the table have sole voting and investment power with respect to all shares of common stock beneficially owned by them.&#160;&#160;Unless otherwise noted, the nature of the ownership set forth in the table below is common stock of the Company.&#160;&#160;The table below sets forth as of June 25, 2016, except as noted in the footnotes to the table, certain information with respect to the beneficial ownership of the Company&#8217;s common stock by (i) all persons or groups, according to the most recent Schedule 13D or Schedule 13G filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission or otherwise known to us, to be the beneficial owners of more than 5% of the outstanding common stock of the Company, (ii) each director of the Company, (iii) the executive officers named in the Summary Compensation Table, and (iv) all such executive officers and directors of the Company as a group.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	Includes directors and officers, as follows: (i) 2,828,620 shares of common stock directly, (ii) options exercisable at an average price of $5.6 per share to purchase 97,500 shares of common stock, all of which are currently exercisable, and (iii) warrants exercisable at $50.00 per share to purchase 39,813 shares of common stock, all&#160;which are currently exercisable.&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<A NAME="INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_ITEM13">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;Certain Relationships and Related Transactions, and Director Independence
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the last two fiscal years, we have not entered into any material transactions or series of transactions that would be considered material in which any officer, director or beneficial owner of 5% or more of any class of our capital stock, or any immediate family member of any of the preceding persons, had direct or indirect material interest, nor are there any such transactions presently proposed, other than the agreements with IGN LLC, an affiliate of Ram Mukunda, as described under &#8220;Executive Compensation &#8211; Compensation for Executive Officers of the Company.&#8221;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are party to indemnification agreements with each of the executive officers and directors.&#160;&#160;Such indemnification agreements require us to indemnify these individuals to the fullest extent permitted by law.
</DIV>

	Table of Contents

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Review, Approval or Ratification of Related Party Transactions
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We do not maintain a formal written procedure for the review and approval of transactions with related persons.&#160;&#160;It is our policy for the disinterested members of our Board to review all related party transactions on a case-by-case basis.&#160;&#160;To receive approval, a related-party transaction must have a business purpose for us and be on terms that are fair and reasonable to us and as favorable to us as would be available from non-related entities in comparable transactions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Director Independence
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The NYSE MKT, upon which our shares are listed, requires the majority of our Board to be &#8220;independent.&#8221;&#160;&#160;The NYSE MKT listing standards define an &#8220;independent director&#8221; generally as a person, other than an officer or an employee of the company, who does not have a relationship with the company that would interfere with the director&#8217;s exercise of independent judgment.&#160;&#160;Consistent with these standards, the Board of Directors has determined that Richard Prins and Sudhakar Shenoy are independent directors.
</DIV>
</EFX_OFFICER_TRANSACTIONS>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_ACCOUNTANT_FEES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTANT_FEES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<A NAME="INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_ITEM14">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 14.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Principal Accountant Fees and Services
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	AJSH &amp; Co LLP, Chartered Accountants (&#8220;AJSH &amp; Co LLP&#8221;) is our Principal Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm engaged to examine our financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160;&#160;During the Company&#8217;s most two recent fiscal years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015 and through June 25, 2016, the Company did not consult with AJSH &amp; Co LLP on (i) the application of accounting principles to a specified transaction, either completed or proposed, or the type of audit opinion that may be rendered on the Company&#8217;s financial statements, and AJSH &amp; Co LLP have not provided either a written report or oral advice to the Company that was an important factor considered by the Company in reaching a decision as to any accounting, auditing, or financial reporting issue; or (ii) the subject of any disagreement, as defined in Item 304(a)(1)(iv) of Regulation S-K and the related instructions, or a reportable event within the meaning set forth in Item 304(a)(1)(v) of Regulation S-K.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Audit Related and Other Fees

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The table below shows the fees that we paid or accrued for the audit and other services provided by AJSH &amp; Co LLP for the fiscal years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015.&#160;&#160;Except as specified otherwise in the table, we paid the fees to AJSH &amp; Co LLP.
</DIV>

	This category includes the audit of our annual financial statements, review of financial statements included in our annual and quarterly reports and services that are normally provided by the independent registered public accounting firms in connection with engagements for those fiscal years.&#160;&#160;This category also includes advice on audit and accounting matters that arose during, or as a result of, the audit or the review of interim financial statements.

	7,280
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; WIDTH: 47%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Total
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 11%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	75,000
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 4PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 11%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	64,280
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: 1%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	42
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage76"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: NORMAL">
<A HREF="#INDIAGLOBAL10K033116_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Policy on Pre-Approval of Audit and Permissible Non-audit Services of Independent Auditors
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Consistent with SEC policies regarding auditor independence, the audit committee of our Board of Directors has responsibility for appointing, setting compensation and overseeing the work of the independent auditor.&#160;&#160;In recognition of this responsibility, our Board of Directors has established a policy to pre-approve all audit and permissible non-audit services provided by the independent auditor.&#160;&#160;Prior to engagement of the independent auditor for the next year&#8217;s audit, management may submit, if necessary, an aggregate of services expected to be rendered during that year for each of the following four categories of services to our Board of Directors for approval.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZF120EFEEACB24625A2A6564F740E779E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Audit
</FONT>
	services include audit work performed in the preparation of financial statements, as well as work that generally only the independent auditor can reasonably be expected to provide, including comfort letters, statutory audits, and attest services and consultation regarding financial accounting and/or reporting standards.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZAE545181681946EF92C87011A9581F96" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Audit-Related
</FONT>
	services are for assurance and related services that are traditionally performed by the independent auditor, including due diligence related to mergers and acquisitions, employee benefit plan audits, and special procedures required to meet certain regulatory requirements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z0D9C0CA88814436B8153002AC94C2441" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tax
</FONT>
	services include all services performed by the independent auditor&#8217;s tax personnel except those services specifically related to the audit of the financial statements, and includes fees in the areas of tax compliance, tax planning and tax advice.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z09BAE40D634F40599ACE7AE5F91F3AFD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 36PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Other
</FONT>
	Fees are those associated with services not captured in the other categories.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Prior to engagement, our Board of Directors pre-approves these services by category of service.&#160;&#160;The fees are budgeted and our Board of Directors requires the independent auditor and management to report actual fees versus the budget periodically throughout the year by category of service.&#160;&#160;During the year, circumstances may arise when it may become necessary to engage the independent auditor for additional services not contemplated in the original pre-approval.&#160;&#160;In those instances, our Board of Directors requires specific pre-approval before engaging the independent auditor.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our audit committee may delegate pre-approval authority to one or more of its members.&#160;&#160;The member to whom such authority is delegated must report, for informational purposes only, any pre-approval decisions to our Board of Directors at its next scheduled meeting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Pre-Approved Services
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Audit Committee&#8217;s charter provides for pre-approval of audit, audit-related and tax services to be performed by the independent auditors.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee approved the audit, audit-related and tax services to be performed by independent auditors and tax professionals in 2016.&#160;&#160;The charter also authorizes the Audit Committee to delegate to one or more of its members pre-approval authority with respect to permitted services.&#160;&#160;The decisions of any Audit Committee member to whom pre-approval authority is delegated must be presented to the full Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee has not delegated such authority to its members.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Audit Committee Report
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Audit Committee of the Board is composed of two directors, each of whom meets the current NYSE MKT test for independence.&#160;&#160;The Committee acts under a written charter adopted by the Board.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee has prepared the following report on its activities with respect to the Company&#8217;s audited financial statements for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 (the &#8220;Audited Financial Statements&#8221;):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z2B6755128E10426D838AC362F626819F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 72PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	The Audit Committee reviewed and discussed the Company&#8217;s Audited Financial Statements with management;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="ZFDDF5F3C21F0491EB70F82B2BB344075" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 72PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	The Audit Committee discussed with AJSH &amp; Co LLP the Company&#8217;s independent auditors for fiscal year 2016, the matters required to be discussed by Statements on Auditing Standards No. 61 (Codification of Statements on Auditing Standards, AU &#167;380), as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in Rule 3200T;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 72PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z0FB8E33326E044B9955860ECD9D03B58" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 72PT; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO">
	The Audit Committee received from the independent auditors the written disclosures regarding auditor independence and the letter required by Independence Standards Board Standard No. 1 (Independence Discussions with Audit Committees), discussed with AJSH &amp; Co LLP, its independence from the Company and its management, and considered whether AJSH &amp; Co LLP&#8217;s provision of non-audit services to the Company was compatible with the auditor&#8217;s independence; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	43
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z1069BDE8A54142B8B137838BF30DCA28" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</TD>

	Based on the review and discussion referred to above, and in reliance thereon, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board that the Audited Financial Statements be included in the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, for filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
</TD>

	All members of the Audit Committee concur in this report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<EFX_PART_IV>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_IV"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	PART IV
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="Z483B6E199CD345F99266F1210248924A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
</TD>
